title.rendered: Hobart vs Melbourne, Australian T20 League, 2022: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Matthew Wade will miss this game due to personal reasons. Nathan Ellis will take over the captaincy role.

Hobart: Caleb Jewell, Ben McDermott (wk), D’Arcy Short, Zak Crawley, Tim David, Asif Ali, Faheem Ashraf, Wil Parker/Chris Tremain, Joel Paris/Mitch Owen, Nathan Ellis (c), Riley Meredith

Marcus Stoinis has been ruled out due to a hamstring injury. Trent Boult will also not be available.

Melbourne: Joe Clarke (wk), Thomas Rogers, Beau Webster, Hilton Cartwright, Nick Larkin, Campbell Kellaway, Liam Hatcher, Brody Couch, Nathan Coulter-Nile, Luke Wood, Adam Zampa (c)

Venue: Bellerive Oval, Hobart

Pitch Report

(Based on the last 2 games).

1st innings average score: 150

2nd innings average score: 146

Wickets per innings: 7

Type: Even contest between bat and ball.

Weather: Clear.

Wins

Batting 1st: 50%

Batting 2nd: 50%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

When these two sides met earlier in the league, Joe Clarke smashed the first century (101*off 66) of the tournament.

On the bowling front, Adam Zampa and Luke Wood each bagged a three-wicket haul.

Patrick Dooley (12) and Riley Meredith (11) are the top two wicket-takers for Hobart this season.

When Caleb Jewell and Ben McDermott batted against Adelaide a week ago in Hobart, they ended up with scores of 54 and 53 respectively.

64 boundaries have already been launched at the venue in the last two games. Clearly, plenty of bonus points in the offering.
